thread.title: Kym Marsh tells Piers Morgan she's 'playing hard to get' during flirty Good Morning Britain chat
thread.title_full: Kym Marsh tells Piers Morgan she's 'playing hard to get' during flirty Good Morning Britain chat

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Kym Marsh tells Piers Morgan she's 'playing hard to get' during flirty Good Morning Britain chat
text:
Kym Marsh tells Piers Morgan she's 'playing hard to get' during flirty Good Morning Britain chat The host told the Corrie star she was at the top of his "pinup list" Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Kym Marsh jokes with Piers Morgan that she's playing 'hard to get' Share this video Get celebs   
Kym Marsh joked she has just been "playing hard to get" with Piers Morgan after a playfully flirty start to their chat on ITV's Good Morning Britain . 
The Coronation Street star appeared on the show on Wednesday and was introduced to viewers as top of the host's "pinup list", although he teased that she didn't return his affections. 
"I think I'm playing hard to get," she quipped, later laughing as Piers talked about the "very handsome young man" she's in a relationship with. Kym joked she was just playing hard to get (Photo: ITV) Piers wants to be her Corrie love interest (Photo: ITV) 
After he joked that he was depressed over her romance with toyboy Matt Baker, Kym teased that "you never know". 
The pair also laughed about the possibility of having an on-screen love story on Corrie, with the soap actress suggesting a Comic Relief skit. Could it happen for Comic Relief? (Photo: ITV) Kym was happy to joke around (Photo: ITV) She is dating Matt Baker (Photo: WENN) 
"I would like to see that happen," she admitted. Read More 
Kym also opened up about the difficult storyline which has seen her reliving her own miscarriage pain, and she praised how Corrie bosses addressed the heartbreaking issue. Kym was in good spirits during the chat (Photo: ITV) She did open up about her heartbreaking storyline (Photo: ITV) 
"My reasons behind agreeing to go ahead with it were in the hopes that it might help somebody somewhere," she explained. 
"It was the must truthful journey that it could have taken, really." Like us on Facebook
